Agent¶

class simulate.agent.agent.Agent(id: int, honesty: float, character: str, random_dict: dict, log: any, conf: dict)¶

Bases: object

Represents an agent in the simulation with defined characteristics and memory.

initialise_memory() → None¶

Initializes the agent’s memory with predefined values from the configuration.

setup_character(character: str) → None¶

Sets up the agent’s character attributes based on the provided character mapping e.g., self.deceptive.”

Parameters:

character (str) – Character traits of the agent.

setup_memory() → None¶

Initializes the agent’s memory structures for friendships and information states.

class simulate.agent.initiator.Initiator(agent)¶

Bases: object

Responsible for initiating conversations by selecting settings, listeners, and topics based on agent characteristics.

draw_topic(agents: list[int]) → int¶

Draws a topic based on the weights derived from relationships and friendships.

Parameters:

agents (list[int]) – A list of agent IDs.

Returns:

The ID of the drawn topic.

Return type:

int

pick_listeners(setting: str) → dict¶

Selects listeners based on the conversation setting and the agent’s character.

Parameters:

setting (str) – The setting for the conversation.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the selected listener IDs and their weights.

Return type:

dict

pick_setting() → str¶

Selects the conversation setting (one-to-one or one-to-all) based on a probability.

Returns:

The chosen setting, either “one_to_one” or “one_to_all”.

Return type:

str

pick_topic() → int¶

Selects the conversation topic based on the agent’s character and relationships.

Returns:

The ID of the chosen topic.

Return type:

int

rank_listeners(others: list[int]) → ndarray¶

Ranks potential listeners based on friendship and relationship weights.

Parameters:

others (list[int]) – A list of IDs of potential listeners.

Returns:

An array of weights representing the ranking of the listeners.

Return type:

np.ndarray

class simulate.agent.updater.Updater(agent, log)¶

Bases: object

Handles updating the mind attributes of the associated agent.

add_to_buffer(obj) → None¶

Adds an object to the internal buffer for later processing.

awareness(honest: bool, topic: int, statement: Info) → None¶

Updates the agent’s awareness of a topic based on the received statement.

Parameters:

  • honest (bool) – Indicates if the speaker is honest.

  • topic (int) – The topic being discussed.

  • statement (Info) – The statement made by the speaker.

update(topic: int, speaker: int) → None¶

Updates the beliefs of the agent based on buffered information.

Parameters:

  • topic (int) – The topic being discussed.

  • speaker (int) – The speaker providing information.

update_ToM(trust: float, speaker: int, topic: int, statement: Info) → None¶

Updates the Theory of Mind (ToM) for the speaker based on trust and the statement.

Parameters:

  • trust (float) – The level of trust in the speaker’s statement.

  • speaker (int) – The ID of the speaker.

  • topic (int) – The topic being discussed.

  • statement (Info) – The statement made by the speaker.

update_friendship(speaker: int, statement: float) → None¶

Updates the friendship value between the agent and another speaker.

Parameters:

  • speaker (int) – The ID of the speaker whose friendship value is being updated.

  • statement (float) – The statement (Beta.mean) made by the speaker used to evaluate the update.
